org.fcrepo.kernel.modeshape.utils

Class FedoraTypesUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fcrepo.kernel.modeshape.utils.FedoraTypesUtils
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FedoraTypes

    public abstract class FedoraTypesUtils
extends Object
implements FedoraTypes
    Convenience class with static methods for manipulating Fedora types in the JCR.
    Since:
    Feb 14, 2013
    Author:
    ajs6f

      • isExternalNode

        public static Predicate<javax.jcr.Node> isExternalNode
        Check if a node is externally managed. Note: modeshape uses a source-workspace-identifier scheme to identify whether a node is externally-managed. Ordinary (non-external) nodes will have simple UUIDs as an identifier. These are never external nodes. External nodes will have a 7-character hex code identifying the "source", followed by another 7-character hex code identifying the "workspace", followed by a "/" and then the rest of the "identifier". Following that scheme, if a node's "source" key does not match the repository's configured store name, then it is an external node.

    • Constructor Detail

        public static Optional<Integer> getPropertyType(javax.jcr.Node node,
                                                String propertyName)
                                         throws javax.jcr.RepositoryException
        Get the JCR property type ID for a given property name. If unsure, mark it as UNDEFINED.
        Parameters:
        node - the JCR node to add the property on
        propertyName - the property name
        Returns:
        a PropertyType value
        Throws:
        javax.jcr.RepositoryException - if repository exception occurred

      • isMultivaluedProperty

        public static boolean isMultivaluedProperty(javax.jcr.Node node,
                                            String propertyName)
                                     throws javax.jcr.RepositoryException
        Determine if a given JCR property name is single- or multi- valued. If unsure, choose the least restrictive option (multivalued = true)
        Parameters:
        node - the JCR node to check
        propertyName - the property name (which may or may not already exist)
        Returns:
        true if the property is multivalued
        Throws:
        javax.jcr.RepositoryException - if repository exception occurred
